text.div:
Generated Narrative: ValueSet gridhamd-answer-options-vs-q15

  • Include these codes as defined in http://example.org/fhir/CodeSystem/gridhamd-answer-options-cs
    CodeDisplay
    Q15-1Absent and Absent or clinically insignificant
    Q15-2Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Absent or clinically insignificant
    Q15-3Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Occasional
    Q15-4Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Much of the time
    Q15-5Mild (preoccupation with bodily functions and sensations, but no concerns about a specific illness) and Almost all the time
    Q15-6Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Occasional
    Q15-7Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Much of the time
    Q15-8Moderate (Excessive or unrealistic worry about having an illness, e.g., “I worry that these headaches are from a brain tumor.”) and Almost all the time
    Q15-9Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and Occasional
    Q15-10Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and Much of the time
    Q15-11Severe (Strong unrealistic conviction of having an illness, e.g., “I am convinced I have cancer”) and almost all of the time
    Q15-12Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Occasional
    Q15-13Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Much off the time
    Q15-14Very Severe (Somatic delusions or hallucinations, e.g., “My insides are rotting”) and Almost all of the time
